title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Hi,

Clients battery expanded and I replaced it. Booted, unit was waking from hibernation but was stuck, force powered it down and it wont come up since. No chime no fan.
Client had 3rd party charger. Board looks fine - cant see any cracks/burns.
Charger goes from green to orange with battery plugged in

I took a few voltages, with no battery connected:

PPBUS_G3H - 12.45V
PP5V_S5 - 4.99V
P3V3S5_LL - 3.28V
P5VS3_PGOOD - 0V
S5_PWRGD - 3.13V
PM_BATLOW_L - 0V
PM_RSMRST_L - 0.02V
PM_PWRBTN_L - 3.41 V
SMC_ONOFF_L - 3.42V

Not sure if those are helpful

I have a little experience diagnosing those

Please assist,
Thank you in advance

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L - 0V"
Be sure to use original Magsafe 1 85W charger.

Of course disconnect the battery when you test the machine.
No need to connect it, untill get the machine working on charger alone.

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Ok, got the charger
Unfortunately PM_BATLOW_L  still at 0v

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
You could have a SMC issue.
Crappy battery can kill it...

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Hi
No life at all even trying smc bypass :(

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Does it charge the battery at least?
You should try other SMC drom donor board.

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Yes, its charging the battery
I dont think I have this SMC, I guess I will just get another board :/ Shame

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

Does it start with both charger and battery connected?

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
ok
PM_PWRBTN_L drops from 3.41v to 0.14v.
I only have multimeter I hope thats ok

title: 820-2915-B No fan after battery replacement
message:
Then SMC send the power button information to PCH.
But this cannot respond if PM_BATLOW_L stays low.
So try another SMC.
